title: How to Get Over a Stomach Ache

steps.title: Take an over-the-counter antacid if you have acid indigestion.
steps.content: Take an over-the-counter antacid if you have acid indigestion. Stomach aches may be beat by neutralizing the acid in the stomach with different medicines. Antacids like Pepto-Bismol, Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids help to coat the stomach and counteract the negative effects of stomach acids. Take these treatments in tablet or liquid form, as directed by a pharmacist or physician. [1] X Research source To prevent stomach aches, take a stomach-acid blocker like Pepcid Complete about 30 minutes before eating. Stomach aches caused by indigestion may be accompanied by heartburn, another symptom of indigestion. Antacids can help manage indigestion, but they don't treat the root cause. Work with your doctor to manage the causes of your indigestion and keep stomach aches away long-term.

steps.title: Take a laxative to ease pain caused by constipation.
steps.content: Take a laxative to ease pain caused by constipation. If constipation is causing your stomach ache, ask your pharmacist or doctor about taking a laxative to stimulate bowel movement. Mild over-the-counter laxatives may take 2-3 days to work, while stimulant laxatives will work faster with possible side effects like cramping. Take the medication exactly as directed and do not exceed the approved dose. [2] X Trustworthy Source FamilyDoctor.org Family-focused medical advice site run by the American Academy of Family Doctors Go to source Do not use laxatives for more than 2 weeks at a time as your body may become dependant on them. Your stomach ache is likely to be caused by constipation if you are also experiencing bloating, fatigue, or loss of appetite.

steps.title: Take an over-the-counter gas relief medication to ease gas pains.
steps.content: Take an over-the-counter gas relief medication to ease gas pains. Overeating, consuming high-fiber foods, and eating too fast can all cause gas. Ease stomach pain caused by excess gas by taking an over-the-counter medication that contains simethicone. This ingredient will help to break up the bubbles in gas allowing it to pass through your digestive tract more easily. [3] X Research source Your stomach ache is likely caused by excess gas if you are burping, passing gas, and have a bloated and distended stomach. For gas-related stomach aches, you can also get digestive enzymes. These help reduce symptoms such as pain, indigestion, bloating, and gas.

steps.title: Consume ginger to ease indigestion.
steps.content: Consume ginger to ease indigestion. Ginger is know for being a digestive aid and easing upset stomachs. Drink ginger tea or water infused with natural ginger to ease your stomach ache. Avoid commercial ginger ales, as most do not contain much actual ginger and are very high in sugar. [4] X Research source To make ginger water, peel and chop a ginger root that is approximately 3 inches (7.6 cm) long and add it to 8 cups (1,900 ml) of filtered water. Add lemon if desired to round out the ginger taste. Let it sit overnight in the fridge and enjoy. Not everyone gets relief with ginger. Although it is a fairly safe and tasty way to treat stomach aches, for reasons not entirely understood some people simply get little effect from ginger.

steps.title: Drink chamomile tea to relax stomach muscles.
steps.content: Drink chamomile tea to relax stomach muscles. It can help to relax the muscle contractions of the upper digestive tract to possibly help relieve stomach aches and mild constipation. Add 1 chamomile teabag to 1 cup (240 ml) of boiling water and steep for 3-4 minutes before drinking it. [5] X Research source Chamomile also has sedative properties that can help ease digestive problems.

steps.title: Reach for peppermint tea or candy to possibly reduce stomach pains.
steps.content: Reach for peppermint tea or candy to possibly reduce stomach pains. Peppermint helps to improve the flow of bile in the body, which helps digestion and prevents stomach issues. For a potent dose of peppermint, drink a cup of peppermint tea. Alternatively, opt for peppermint candy, which is less potent but may still benefit your stomach. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Place a heating pad or hot water bottle on your stomach for additional relief.
steps.content: Place a heating pad or hot water bottle on your stomach for additional relief. Heat can increase blood flow to the surface of your skin. When applied to your abdomen, a heat source may make your stomach ache more bearable and relax your muscles. Place a heating pad or hot water bottle on your abdomen for 10-20 minutes to see if your pain improves. [7] X Research source Avoid placing the heat source directly on your skin to prevent damage. If your skin gets red or sore, remove the heat source immediately.

steps.title: Eat fermented foods to aid digestion.
steps.content: Eat fermented foods to aid digestion. Fermented foods and drinks contain beneficial bacteria that help your body digest food easily. Aim to introduce 2-3 servings of these products to your diet per week to benefit your digestive system. They include: [8] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Kefir, a fermented milk product Kombucha, a fermented tea Sauerkraut, a fermented cabbage mixture Miso, a paste made from fermented soy

steps.title: Choose simple, complex carbohydrates that are easy for the body to digest.
steps.content: Choose simple, complex carbohydrates that are easy for the body to digest. Eating foods that your body has to work hard to digest may result in a worsened stomach ache when you are trying to recover. Stick to simple, complex carbohydrates like bread and rice. Bananas and applesauce are also known to be easy on your stomach. [9] X Trustworthy Source FamilyDoctor.org Family-focused medical advice site run by the American Academy of Family Doctors Go to source For instance, steer clear of hearty foods like whole grain bread and spinach while your stomach recovers.

steps.title: Avoid spicy foods that may irritate your stomach lining.
steps.content: Avoid spicy foods that may irritate your stomach lining. Stomach aches are usually caused by an inflamed stomach lining so its important to be gentle to your digestive system as you recover. Choose mild foods that are relatively free of spice and seasonings. To avoid any unwanted ingredients in your food, opt to cook your own meals while you get over a stomach ache. [10] X Research source Bland meal options like a plain turkey sandwich or an unseasoned chicken breast with rice are good examples.

steps.title: Eat yogurt to improve digestion and soothe your stomach.
steps.content: Eat yogurt to improve digestion and soothe your stomach. Yogurt that is labeled as having "active cultures" will increase the number of healthy bacteria in your stomach, which will improve your digestion. It can also soothe a sore stomach and help reduce bloating. Opt for plain yogurt, as certain fruits or additives may irritate your stomach further. [11] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source If possible, choose organic yogurt to avoid additives.

steps.title: Eat enough fiber.
steps.content: Eat enough fiber. Many people on a typical Western diet get insufficient fiber, and then experience issues like constipation. Foods rich in fiber include such foods as: Whole grain breads High fiber cereals Fruit Vegetables Fiber enriched foods: These include items such as fiber enriched bars, yogurts, cookies and the like.

steps.title: See your doctor if you experience recurring stomach aches.
steps.content: See your doctor if you experience recurring stomach aches. If you regularly experience stomach aches, see your doctor as soon as possible. Abdominal pain can be a symptom of numerous medical issues that may require immediate treatment, medication, or surgery. Tell your doctor about any other symptoms you may be experiencing to help narrow down the cause of your pain. [12] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Inform your doctor about any recent changes in diet or lifestyle that may be playing a part in your stomach trouble. Your doctor will likely do a physical examination, and may do laboratory, radiological, or endoscopic testing.

steps.title: Try meditation to ease stomach pain due to stress.
steps.content: Try meditation to ease stomach pain due to stress. Doing meditation every day can lower your overall stress level and curb the physical symptoms associated with it. Regular meditation may also reduce stomach issues caused by inflammation and gut disorders. For at least 15-20 minutes each day, meditate by sitting quietly and focusing on breathing in slow, purposeful intervals. [13] X Research source Choose a place and time to meditate where you will not be interrupted.

steps.title: Exercise in 30-minute sessions to improve your metabolism.
steps.content: Exercise in 30-minute sessions to improve your metabolism. Exercise can help ease and prevent stomach aches by reducing stress and improving your metabolism. To get the full benefit of moderate exercise, do at least 30 minutes of cardio 4-5 times a week. Try activities like: [14] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Jogging Biking Swimming Rollerblading Speed walking Rowing Dancing

steps.title: Do yoga to improve digestion.
steps.content: Do yoga to improve digestion. Doing yoga has many benefits, including stress relief and better digestion. Take a beginner's yoga class in your area to learn the basics and practice different poses. Alternatively, attempt a few basic poses on your own such as: [15] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source "Apanasana", where you lie on your back and hug your knees to your chest for 5-10 counts. The "bridge pose," where you lie on the floor, bend your knees, and move your hips up to stretch your body. The "child's pose," where you sit on your knees, lean forward, and stretch your arms out in front of you.
